channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: The Juneteenth flag is full of symbols. Here's what they mean
item.description: Designing the Juneteenth flag was a deliberate process, says creator Ben Haith, who breaks down what each element of the flag represents.

item.title: Russia obliterates front-line Ukraine towns by retrofitting bombs
item.description: Russia is intensifying its use of cheap glide bombs to lay waste to cities in eastern Ukraine

item.title: Nvidia’s surge reveals a pitfall of passive investing: Morning Brief
item.description: Read more on this topic here

item.title: 6/19: CBS Evening News
item.description: Raging New Mexico wildfires burn hundreds of structures; Opal Lee, the Grandmother of Juneteenth, leads annual Walk for Freedom

item.title: June 18 2024: US heat wave news
item.description: A dangerous heat wave is scorching parts of the Midwest and Northeast. Record-breaking high temperatures are forecast across dozens of cities where cooling centers have been opened to protect the vulnerable.

item.title: Shooting in Philadelphia wounds 7 people, police say
item.description: Police say seven people have been wounded in a shooting in Philadelphia

item.title: An Upstate New York favorite with giant sandwiches, soups is coming to Charlotte soon
item.description: Read more on this topic here

item.title: A Moment With: Galen Walters and Sylvain Perrier
item.description: Explore the remarkable collaboration between Galen Walters and Sylvain Perrier, as they lead the team at Mercatus, a Relationshop Company, on a journey to revolutionize the digital shopping experience. Discover how their visionary leadership from an unexpected location is shaping the future of grocery retail technology.

item.title: 'I know it happens': Boeing chief admits the company has retaliated against whistleblowers
item.description: The outgoing chief of the embattled airplane maker is testifying in the wake of a whistleblower's allegations of safety issues.

item.title: Sweltering heat wave continues, with 16 states under heat alerts
item.description: Heat alerts are in effect on Thursday for more than 70 million Americans in 16 states, stretching from Kentucky to Maine.

item.title: Hezbollah leader threatens Cyprus as tensions with Israel ramp up
item.description: Read more on this topic here

item.title: A Moment With: John M. Holmes
item.description: Led by John M. Holmes, AAR is a top independent provider of aviation parts and services to commercial and government customers worldwide. In this episode, Holmes discusses his career journey to becoming AAR’s Chairman, President and CEO, and AAR’s industry leading solutions they offer their customers to increase efficiency and reduce overall costs, while maintaining high levels of quality, service, and safety.

item.title: June 17, 2024 - Israel-Gaza news
item.description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu has disbanded the country's war cabinet, an Israeli official says, just over a week after opposition leader Benny Gantz withdrew from the body.

item.title: Triple murder suspect on the loose: Police
item.description: Arkansas investigators are warning the public about an armed and dangerous suspect allegedly connected to three homicides who is on the loose.

item.title: India shuns China's calls to resume passenger flights after 4 years, officials say
item.description: Read more on this topic here

item.title: Airfield with Taylor Swift's jet targeted by climate activists using orange paint
item.description: Climate activists gained access to a British airport where Taylor Swift's luxury plane is stationed and sprayed private jets with orange paint.

item.title: Confessions of a 1980s flight attendant
item.description: Ann Hood, a best-selling author, has recounted her adventures working as cabin crew on TWA flights in the 1980s in a book detailing the highs and lows of life during the early jet age.

item.title: Treason trial of Russian American woman opens amid rising tensions
item.description: The trial of a Russian American dual citizen whom Russia accuses of treason opened amid rising tensions between Washington and Moscow

item.title: North Korea's Kim gives pair of dogs to Putin
item.description: Read more on this topic here

item.title: Tropical Storm Alberto blamed for several deaths as it moves in on Gulf coast
item.description: Alberto, the season's first named storm, was bringing heavy rain and high winds as it neared Mexico's shoreline near Texas.
